channel.title: How do i space out lines on a window? UPDATED PICS
channel.description:
well, ill have a txt field and stuff etc and it will look like this when i add too many
[img]http://img227.imageshack.us/img227/6429/scrambledck9.png[/img]
when i want it like this the whole way [img]http://img412.imageshack.us/img412/1874/notscrambledis9.png[/img]
how you i line them up like that?

item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Alternatively, you can build your GUIs the smart way using an IDE like Netbeans. Then it’s just a matter of copying and pasting that code to where it’s needed. Only suckers do GUIs manually.

item.title: How do i space out lines on a window? UPDATED PICS
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

how would i know what coords to put it on?

so it would be like. e.g button1.setBounds(x, y, width, height);

also, what would i put in the hight and width? leave it?

Read full topic
item.source: How do i space out lines on a window? UPDATED PICS

item.title: How do i space out lines on a window? UPDATED PICS
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Use a null layout and use Component.setBounds(x, y, width, height).
x and y being the top left corner of the component.

This way is a bit more tedious, but it will look exactly like you want it to.

Read full topic
